trigger.description: PgSQL: Low free disk space on data partition: <1% on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: bloat is too high on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: tnx is too long in idle state on {HOSTNAME}
Low free disk (<20%) space on PostgreSQL partition on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.comments: Check pg_stat_activity view. If it is non-OLTP database, feel free to ignore.
ZTC was unable to connect to database and execute simple query. Please check that postgres is up and you have correct ztc configuration. For more info, run /opt/ztc/bin/pgsql.py ping -d

trigger.description: Low free disk (<20%) space on PostgreSQL partition on {HOSTNAME}
Low free disk (<20%) space on PostgreSQL data partition on {HOSTNAME}
Low free disk (<5%) space on PostgreSQL data partition on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: Too many wal files on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: Low free disk space on backups partition: <5% on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: low free disk space on backups partition (<1%) on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: Low free disk space on data partiton (<1%)
PgSQL: too close to to autovacuum_freeze_max_age on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.comments: Run `/opt/ztc/bin/pgsql.py autovac_freeze -d` to chech what databases caused this and vacuum them

trigger.description: Low free disk (<20%) space on PostgreSQL backups partition on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.comments: Check pg_stat_activity view. If it is non-OLTP database, feel free to ignore.
